intro: Holoschoenus mexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican holoschoenus, is a rare flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that are typically green or reddish in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
